body.p:
Madisonville 1st Feby 1861
H H Smith Esqr
Frankfort Ky

Dear friend I have just now learned by a friend that Genl Wadlington & James McGoodwin of Princeton have gone to Frankfort with a view of making intercession for the unfortunate F. B. Wadlington who is under sentence of death for the murder of Cartwright. The people of Hopkins as well as those of Caldwell County are strongly impressed with the belief that the conviction of T. B. Wadlington is unjust and based wholy upon false Testimony.. that W killed Cartwright we have no doubt, but that he did it in self defence & that he was shot first we have not a solitary dout In consequence of this we have gotten petitioners in this county numbering about six hundred, and will send them tomorrow morning by private hand to Princeton and from these will endeavor to have them sent on by express to his Excellency Gov McGoffin We therefore ask you to inform the Governor. McGoodwin, & Genl Wadlington of -- the fact, that our Petitions will reach there in a few days and to give them time to arrive before pressing the Governor to a decision in the case

We think we see the right spirit and feeling manifested by our Ky Legislature. such as will teach both the extreme North & South, that Ky stand as she has ever stood true & Loyal to the Union. Hopking you will have good health we subscribe ourselves

Your friends truly
Geo W Noel
Joseph Fuquay

N B
If you can say any thing in favor our unfortunate Wadlingtons case to Gov McGoffin do so. You a least can say truly that you
are acquainted with many of the petitioners and testify as to their character &c. &c.
